TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Goats[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goats[COLOR_REVERT] can be raised on flatlands on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. To make a colonist herd goats, assign him to the [LINK=PROFESSION_GOATHERD]goatherd[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Goat production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_GOAT]goat[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RANCH]ranches[\LINK] on goat-producing plots and employing [LINK=UNIT_GOATHERD]expert goatherds[\LINK]. These experts can be trained in Native villages or hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Goats will eat vegetation that most other domesticated livestock decline, so they can subsist on very poor land. The number of animals that a goat farmer can sustain depends on the quality of the pasture. A poor man with poor land can still raise goats.[NEWLINE]Perhaps because of their adaptability, goats have become a symbol of evil. Witches are said to cavort with goats. Satan has goat horns.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Ziegen[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Pigs[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT] can be raised on flatlands on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. To make a colonist raise pigs, assign him to the [LINK=PROFESSION_PIG_FARMER]pig farmer[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Pig production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_PIG]pig[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RANCH]ranches[\LINK] on pig-producing plots and employing [LINK=UNIT_GOATHERD]expert pig farmers[\LINK]. These experts can be trained in Native villages or hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Historically a few pigs would be kept near the owner's residence. They could be tethered in a simple shelter or kept in a pen outside the owner's house.[NEWLINE]Hog farming is when pigs are bred on a domestic or industrial scale. Pigs are raised for food and skins.[NEWLINE]They're valued for their ability to convert inedible food into meat and manure, and can be fed household food waste. On a large scale pigs are one way to dispose of municipal garbage.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Schweine[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Chicken[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chickens[COLOR_REVERT] can be raised on flatlands on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. To make a colonist raise chickens, assign him to the [LINK=PROFESSION_CHICKEN_FARMER]chicken farmer[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Chicken production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_CHICKEN]chicken[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RANCH]ranches[\LINK] on chicken-producing plots and employing [LINK=UNIT_CHICKEN_FARMER]expert chicken farmers[\LINK]. These experts can be trained in Native villages or hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Free-range poultry farming allows chickens to roam during the day, although they are usually confined in coops at night to protect them from predators. They're also kept indoors when the weather is bad.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Hühner[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Domestic Geese[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Geese[COLOR_REVERT] can be raised on flatlands on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. To make a colonist raise geese, assign him to the [LINK=PROFESSION_GOOSE_FARMER]goose farmer[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Goose production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_GOOSE]goose[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RANCH]ranches[\LINK] on goose-producing plots and employing [LINK=UNIT_GOOSE_FARMER]expert goose farmers[\LINK]. These experts can be trained in Native villages or hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Geese are the fastest growers among domestic birds. They're hardy and disease free when given constant care. Geese can be brought up on green pasture, which lowers production cost substantially.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Hausgänse[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Goat Hides[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goat hides[COLOR_REVERT] come from butchered [LINK=YIELD_GOATS]goats[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_GOATS]goat butcher[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of goat hides can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]master butchers[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]The goat is one of the oldest domesticated animals. There's archaeological evidence for goats in Iran 10,000 years ago. Goats are used for milk, meat, fur, and skins across much of the world.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Ziegenfelle[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Pig Skins[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigskins[COLOR_REVERT] come from butchered [LINK=YIELD_PIGS]pigs[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_PIGS]pig butcher[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of pigskins can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]master butchers[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Pigskin is softer than cow leather and is preferred for detailed items such as gloves. Pigskin jackets are more supple than the heavier cow leather jacket, which however is more durable. Pig leather is easier to work, so garments typically have a finer finish.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Schweinehäute[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Downs[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Down[COLOR_REVERT] comes from butchered [LINK=YIELD_GEESE]geese[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_GEESE]goose butcher[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of down can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]master butchers[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Down is the warm inner feathers plucked from waterfowl. It's used as a lightweight insulator in clothing and bedding.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Daunen[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Wildbird Feathers[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wild bird feathers[COLOR_REVERT] come from [LINK=YIELD_GEESE]wild birds[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER_BIRDS]bird hunter[\LINK] profession. The output of wild bird feathers can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_HUNTER]expert hunters[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe or trained in Native villages.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Wild bird feathers were valued for clothing decoration, hats in particular. The biggest demand was for feathers from brightly coloured tropical birds.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Wildvogelfedern[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Goathide Boots[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goat hide boots[COLOR_REVERT] are made from [LINK=YIELD_GOAT_HIDE]goat hide[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_TAILOR_LEATHER]leather tailor[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of goat hide boots can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_TAILOR]master tailors[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Goat hide can be used for finely crafted dress boots, gloves for the feet, or the boots can be insulated for cold weather use.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Ziegenlederstiefel[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Pig Leather Aprons[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLDStrategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pig leather aprons[COLOR_REVERT] are made from [LINK=YIELD_PIG_SKINS]pigskins[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_TAILOR_LEATHER]leather tailor[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of pig leather aprons can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_TAILOR]master tailors[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Pig leather aprons are hard-wearing work clothing, used by blacksmiths to block sparks from the forge and by butchers in case knives slip.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Schweinelederschürzen[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Fruit[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fruit[COLOR_REVERT] grows on many different terrains. To harvest it, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_FRUITS_PICKER]fruit picker[\LINK] profession. The fruit harvest can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_FRUITS_PICKER]expert fruit pickers[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe or trained in Native villages.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Because the fruit varieties mature at different times throughout the season, fruit pickers are often migrant, moving among the orchards and farms as needed. In the tropics fruit grows year-round. Bananas are the world's most popular fruit. Apples are common in temperate zones, and some berries grow in the taiga or tundra.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Früchte[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Rapeseed[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] >The Romans introduced rapeseed to Western Europe. During the Middle Ages farmers used it in crop rotation to keep weeds down and improve the soil.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rapeseed oil was rarely eaten by humans. The old strains were horribly bitter and contained high levels of toxic erucic acid. The oil was used in animal feed for centuries and later as a lubricant during the Industrial Revolution.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the 1970s farmers developed new strains of rapeseed with low levels of erucic acid. This palatable oil, known as canola oil in North America, is widely marketed as a cooking oil.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Raps[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: The Romans introduced rapeseed to Western Europe. During the Middle Ages farmers used it in crop rotation to keep weeds down and improve the soil.[PARAGRAPH:1]The old strains were horribly bitter and contained high levels of toxic erucic acid. Rarely eaten by humans, the oil was used in animal feed for centuries and later as a lubricant during the Industrial Revolution.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the 1970s farmers developed new strains of rapeseed with low levels of erucic acid. This palatable oil, known as canola oil in North America, is widely marketed as a cooking oil.

>Rapeseed oil was rarely eaten by humans since it was horribly bitter and contained high levels of toxic erucic acid. The oil was used in animal feed for centuries and later as a lubricant during the Industrial Revolution.
[TAB][H1]Olive Oil[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, use other Yield Enty as example

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Household Goods[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][TAB][H1]Household Goods[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Household goods[COLOR_REVERT] are purchased in the [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_MARKET]village market[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]As a young man Benjamin Franklin calculated each household individually made 95% of everything needed. Money was only used for nails and to pay taxes. With population growth that certainly changed. Markets became an important part of every community.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Haushaltswaren[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Fieldworker Tools[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][TAB][H1]Fieldworker Tools[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fieldworker tools[COLOR_REVERT] are purchased in the [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_MARKET]village market[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Field workers can be hard on their tools. Axes get dull, shovels bend and hammer heads fly off the handle. A good market will have a hardware section where workers can get what they need.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Feldarbeiterwerkzeuge[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Cochineal[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Chocolate[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD[BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chocolate[COLOR_REVERT] is created from [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_BEANS]cocoa[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_CONFECTIONER]confectioner[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_CONFECTIONER_SHOP]confectioner's shop[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of chocolate can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_CONFECTIONER]master confectioners[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Having a chocolate shop means that the settlers and their children don't need to wait for the ship to come in from Europe to satisfy their sweet tooth. The local confectioner makes everybody happy, the dentist in particular.[NEWLINE]One trick to making good chocolate is grinding the sugar so fine that the candy has a smooth consistency.[NEWLINE]Some chocolatiers even set up tables where tea is served to accompany the treats. A very few offer coffee, at first considered scandalous, because the drink is so stimulating.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Schokolade[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Padded Leather Coats[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Padded leather coats[COLOR_REVERT] are manufactured from [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]hides[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_PADDED_LEATHER_COAT]leather clothier[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_PADDED_LEATHER_COAT_MAKERS_HOUSE] padded leather coat house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of coats can be doubled by commissioning a [LINK=UNIT_PADDED_LEATHER_COAT_MAKER]master leather clothier[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Leather is good at keeping out the wind but when the temperature drops it still feels cold. Putting padding into leather coats keeps people warm when the snow flies. Sewing padding into leather doesn't just make the clothes more comfortable. By adding insulation it also improves health for those working outside, and can even save their lives.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Geplosterte Ledermäntel[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Milk[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Milk[COLOR_REVERT] comes from cows, sheep or goats on [LINK=TERRAIN_HILL]hill[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. To make a colonist produce milk, assign her to the [LINK=PROFESSION_MILKMAID]milkmaid[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Milk production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_CATTLE]cattle[\LINK], [LINK=BONUS_SHEEP]sheep[\LINK] or [LINK=BONUS_GOATS]goats[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RANCH]ranches[\LINK] on livestock-producing plots and employing [LINK=UNIT_MILKMAID]expert milkmaids[\LINK]. These experts can be hired in Europe.[NEWLINE]Milk is the raw material for making [LINK=YIELD_CHEESE]cheese[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Milk[COLOR_REVERT] as a business usually means the milk of cows, goats, or sheep. It's a good source of protein and fat. When used to make [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cheese[COLOR_REVERT], milk is acidified and the enzymes of either rennet or other bacterial enzymes are added to cause the casein to coagulate.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Milch[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Kautschuk[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rubber[COLOR_REVERT] can be collected in [LINK=TERRAIN_JUNGLE]jungle[\LINK] terrain. To make colonists produce rubber, assign them to the [LINK=PROFESSION_KAUTSCHUK_COLLECTOR]rubber collector[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE]Rubber production is highest on plots bearing the [LINK=BONUS_KAUTSCHUK]rubber[\LINK] bonus, and can be increased by employing [LINK=UNIT_KAUTSCHUK_COLLECTOR]expert rubber collectors[\LINK]. These experts can be trained in Native villages or hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rubber[COLOR_REVERT] is harvested by making incisions in the bark of rubber trees. The latex is heated to create rubber that can be dried into waterproof sheets, along with other industrial products. Rubber has a large stretch ratio, high resilience and is also waterproof. It's classified as an elastomer.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Kautschuk[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Cheese[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cheese[COLOR_REVERT] is made from [LINK=YIELD_MILK]milk[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_CHEESE_MAKER]cheesemaker[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_CHEESEMAKERS_HOUSE]cheesemaker's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of cheese can be doubled by commissioning [LINK=UNIT_CHEESE_MAKER]master cheesemakers[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Cheese is produced in a wide range of flavours and textures by coagulation of the milk protein casein. It's made of proteins and fat from milk, usually the milk of cows, goats, or sheep. During production, milk is acidified and the enzymes of either rennet or other bacterial enzymes are added to cause the casein to coagulate. The solid curds are then separated from the liquid whey and pressed into finished cheese.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Käse[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD] TODO, anderen Yield Eintrag als Beispiel nehmen

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]Pottery[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pottery[COLOR_REVERT] is thrown from [LINK=YIELD_CLAY]clay[\LINK]. To do this, a colonist needs to have the [LINK=PROFESSION_POTTER]potter[\LINK] profession in the [LINK=BUILDING_POTTERS_HOUSE]potter's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. The output of pottery can be doubled by commissioning a [LINK=UNIT_POTTER]master potter[\LINK] who can be hired in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Pottery is an ancient way to store grain. Pottery thwarts the rats, mice and insects that would otherwise devour the crop and leave everyone to starve. A few creative types fashion imaginative vessels with decorative patterns, some merely for display. The Puritans strongly object.
